Detailed Description

template<typename I, typename J>
class biolib::trees::binary_tree< I, J >::vertex

Vertex for a binary tree.

The nested class vertex implements a vertex for a binary tree. It is basically three pointers _parent, _left, _right and two objects _data and _edge. The pointers establish the relationship between vertex objects playing as edges between vertices. It is often to associate to each vertex and edge with a particular information. This information can be put in _data and _edge objects, where _data and _edge are the information associate to the vertex and its upper edge respectively, see figure.

Structure of the vertex class

The template parameter I defines the object type associated to the vertex and J the object type associated to the edge. The vertex objects are meant to not be used directly. All the client programmer interaction with the vertex objects will be carried by binary_tree objects or iterators in the way that all vertex are created and destroyed by trees. This will be allowed that if any exception ocurrs, the binary_tree objects will deallocate automatically all the vertices from memory.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename I, typename J>
biolib::trees::binary_tree< I, J >::vertex::vertex ( const I &  data = I(),
const J &  edge = J() 
) [inline, private]

Constructor by data and edge information.

This is the constructor of the class that initialice the values of the objects related to the vertex and its upper edge. By default, the assigned value is given by the default constructor of the objects I and J.

Note:
All the function related to create or modify the relationship between vertices are private making imposible for the user declares or modifies the tree topology directly.

Here is the call graph for this function:

Copy constructor.

Here is the call graph for this function:

template<typename I, typename J>
biolib::trees::binary_tree< I, J >::vertex::~vertex (  )  [inline]

Vertex destructor.

It destroys the actual vertex together with all the vertices that are interconnected to its left and right pointers.

template<typename I, typename J>
bool biolib::trees::binary_tree< I, J >::vertex::leaf (  )  const [inline]

Verified if the vertex is a leaf.

It returns true when the vertex has the left and right pointers NULL.

template<typename I, typename J>
bool biolib::trees::binary_tree< I, J >::vertex::terminal (  )  const [inline]

Verified if the vertex is a terminal.

It returns true when the vertex is degree one.
